intro: Reseda lamottei, commonly known as the lamotte's reseda, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has slender, branched stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the semi-arid climate of its native habitat. Reseda lamottei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
